channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

item.title: Report E-2023060508
item.description:
Report E-2023060508

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-02
  • City: TONAWANDA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 02, 2023, one (1) carboard box containing four (4) one-gallon pails of UN3264 was crushed during transit and released approximately one (1) ounce of product to the cardboard box and adjacent pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the site. ES personnel deployed neutralizing agent and wiped down. The cardboard box and all UN3264 impacted material were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023060795
item.description:
Report X-2023060795

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-15
  • City: BAY SHORE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 2 cardboard boxes on a pallet of UN1759 have been damaged by shifting freight. The pallet with the damaged boxes is located at the left rear of the trlr and the spill is on the trlr floor at the same location. Clean up crew has been notified and sent to the location, 219 advised there is no hot fre ight on the trlr and a callback from local Ft Smith GO/HM after their 0800 start of business would not be a problem.

item.title: Report X-2023060651
item.description:
Report X-2023060651

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-26
  • City: RENSSELAER
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was placed onto a van for dispatch and sent out for delivery. While on his route, the driver noticed the package getting a little wet on the side, he had a black bin in his van and carefully placed it inside the black bin inside a clear bag he had and brought it back to the terminal. DescribePack: The caps were loose on all 4 bottles. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: It is not known if the caps were loosened moving around while driving or prior to dispatch from handling and travel, so exposure was only mitigated when driver noticed the dampness when he placed inside the clear bag and put inside the bin and closed up the bag until he got to the terminal. When he got here we placed it into a yellow hazmat drum and put it under ventilation in the damage hazmat cage.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0

DescribePack: one of the cap to the bottle was found to be loose DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: all materials that spilled out were absorbed by the outer packaging.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that the one poly 55 gallon drum of glacial acetic acid (un2789) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 45 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report X-2023060281
item.description:
Report X-2023060281

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-26
  • City: RENSSELAER
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A package handler found the box that was leaking. This was immediately brought to the hazmat cage for inspection by a hazmat certified employee. Upon inspection I noted 2 caps were loose and no safety seals on either package. The caps failed to operate. I have this contained in a hazmat drum, completed an ISF form, DPR and I am awaiting disposition. DescribePack: 2 loose caps - 2 safety seals missing DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Immediately brought to a hazmat cage and put in a hazmat container under a vent.

item.title: Report X-2023060260
item.description:
Report X-2023060260

  • Description: SequenceEvent: On 05/24/23, a Hazmat package that was loaded on to a delivery vehicle was discovered to be damaged and leaking contents. Upon inspection by QA, it was discovered that a bottle of paramount Super Concentrated Machine Dishwash was damaged and leaking contents from loose cap inside package DescribePack: Package leaking contents from loose cap inside package DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon discovery of damage, package removed from delivery vehicle by QA and placed in red Fedex Ground plastic Hazmat bin with plastic liner and staged in Hazmat cage for future processing. Any liquid that leaked onto ground cleaned with absorbent
